{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine|java alpha}}
|{{HistoryLine||v1.0.1|Redstone wire has an extra, unobtainable item form corresponding to its block ID. It can be obtained via inventory editors with numeric item ID 55.
|Unlike the obtainable redstone dust item, this unobtainable form can replace blocks such as water.}}
|{{HistoryLine|java beta}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.6|dev=Test Build 3|Redstone wire items can be obtained from the newly added debug chests, mainly from the 24th slot of the 2nd chest from the left, and the 8th slot of the 6th chest from the left.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=release|Debug chests no longer spawn, preventing redstone wire items from being obtained this way.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.8|dev=Pre-release 2 ;)|Added pick block functionality. This changes the currently selected slot to any containing this otherwise-unobtainable redstone dust item, but does not allow it to be obtained if not already in the hotbar.}}
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.2.5|dev=pre|Pick Block now returns the actually obtainable redstone dust item.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.3.1|dev=12w15a|Redstone wire items can now be obtained via Pick Block in creative.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=12w16a|Pick Block once again returns the actually obtainable redstone dust item.
|Redstone wire items can now be obtained in singleplayer worlds via the {{cmd|give}} command using the respective numeric ID.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.7.2|dev=13w37a|The direct item form of redstone wire has been removed from the game. It no longer exists as an item in any way, only as a placed block.}}
|{{HistoryLine|pocket alpha}}
|{{HistoryLine||v0.13.0|dev=build 1|Redstone wire has an extra, unobtainable item form corresponding to its block ID. It can be obtained via inventory editors with numeric item ID 55.}}
|{{HistoryLine||v0.16.0|dev=build 1|Redstone wire could be obtained via the use of the /give command.}} 
|{{HistoryLine|console}}
|{{HistoryLine||?|Redstone wire exists as an item.<ref name="console">https://youtu.be/qtn9Nx3YpeU</ref>}}
}}
